summary: Alexandria is Egypt's second-largest city and the biggest on the Mediterranean Sea. Founded by Alexander the Great around 331 BC, it was a significant Greek and later Roman center. Known as the "Bride of the Mediterranean," it's a popular tourist spot due to its history and attractions like the ancient Lighthouse of Alexandria and the Catacombs of Kom El Shoqafa. Alexandria was once the largest city in the world and an intellectual hub. Today, it's an important industrial city because of its oil and gas pipelines.
title: Alexandria
